captions.text: Woke up this morning on the beach,
Started walking, it's my regular routine.
I was on the search for some diamonds,
Let me tell you just what I've seen.
and the woman who lived in a shoe.
and some things I should not go into detail.
You never know what you will find,
shaping a world that's in your mind,
See for yourself and walk with me.
A world of wonder, a land of beauty,
Across the mountains and over the sea,
but I still haven't found any diamonds.
I've been walking around for miles,
still no diamonds to be found.
drilling through dirt, then I fell through,
What have I gotten myself into?
I saw a sparkle in the dark.
I put my axe right through that mark.
At last found me some diamonds.
Oh I'm so happy I could ride a pig!

title: In Search of Diamonds (Minecraft / Music Video)

comments.text: "C4 yourself and walk with me"﻿

comments.author: Technickgear :3

comments.text:
This is my later childhood right here. I liked this even before I knew how 
to properly spell or use grammar. But in any ca-

"@#$% who @#$%ing cares
cool peepl spel rong!!! just deal with it!!!"
Graysongdl, January 1st 2011, 11:29 AM

Ahem... In any case, it was nice coming back to see this video again. Every 
moment of this hit me in the nostalgia.

The best part of being on the internet is that everything you say is 
preserved forever, so you can look back to your own childhood, and Google 
Play even lets me replay the first apps I ever downloaded on a tablet.﻿

comments.author: Mr25joseph

comments.text:
Nostalgia trip oh my god! I remember Minecraft Alpha! so much simpler, 
single player, just making cool builds, no creative, no seeds, no pistons, 
repeaters, cookies, maps, wolves, and SO MUCH MORE. Just you, some trees, 
and the fear of nighttime :) This song is part of what got me into 
Minecraft aside from my cousin in Alpha 1.2.6, and my god I was addicted to 
it for a good 3 years. It was such a huge part of my life (cause I'm only 
15) I even made papercraft models of all of the original mobs, along with 
Steve of course. I'm glad that this was the very first Minecraft song I 
ever heard, it's such a classic!﻿
comments.author: Sean Velhagen

comments.text:
About 4 - 5 years ago I preformed this song at my Talent Show at school. Me 
and my friend memorised all the lyrics and sang it, and dayum we sang it 
good. Then at the end, "I'm so happy I could ride a pig," everybody started 
laughing. By then, nobody knew what Minecraft even was. Those were the good 
days; when little kids were like "Wtf is this game??"﻿

comments.author: viktor malinowski

comments.text:
I remember when minecraft was this simple, when you could join a server and 
just start building, there were no commands, no creative mode, and no 
shitty mini games. There were no crappy youtubers like the whole 
skydoesminecraft shitstorm, all videos were original and entertaining, not 
some guy screaming shit in his mic. Even better, when you could just start 
a singleplayer world and start looking for diamonds. I feel like what used 
to be a truly special and personal experience is just not, well, that fun 
anymore. I mean, these fucking spoilt brats spend $100 on a coloured title 
on a server and try to rub it in your face. If only this game could be like 
it used to be﻿

comments.text:
Every time I watch this video I get a ball of ice in my stomach. It's so 
sad to look at Minecraft now in retrospect to what it was years ago..... I 
just want to break down and cry at the memory of how much I loved Minecraft 
back in the good old days. Multiplayer was fun. Single player was fun. 
Finding my first diamond was unforgettable. Now all people talk about are 
mini games and who the biggest youtuber is. I liked it better when my 
friends would come to me and shout, "COME LOOK AT THIS DUNGEON I FOUND OMG 
OMG OMG OMG WTF THIS IS AMAZING!!!" Now all anyone says is, "Pffff, another 
dungeon"  D':﻿

comments.author: R0bder

comments.text:
I remember when Minecraft was at it's best, this was the time. In old times 
when the community was civil with other players building creations and 
people would love them. 
Then beta 1.8 came round...
This attracted thousands and thousands of midget whiners who all they do is 
rage into their microphone about the 'hacking' players who just play by the 
rules. Also many major YouTubers like SkyDoesMinecraft and The Yogscast 
used to be absolutely great until these midgets came round and started 
worshiping them and demanded more series on mods and NO MORE lets-plays! 
Where have these gone!

Now I shall say to everyone who loved the old style of minecraft, we need 
to stand up and let our word out! Reply to this comment if you agree, if 
you don't have something nice to say, then don't bother replying to it! I 
am sick and tired of people giving grief to people like me who actually 
cares on giving their word out to other people, the minecraft community 
today is being corroded away by these midgets. ﻿
comments.author: Nemora

comments.text:
+Nemora Remember when you couldn't stack fences? And when you had to make 
the weird minecart rail thing to power minecarts cause there were no 
powered rails yet? And when we had to use invedit and SPC and TMI to fly 
and get all the items we ever wanted in Minecraft? Remember when mods were 
really special? Remember when SeaNanners made those Minecraft videos all 
those years ago? Man, Minecraft sure lost its charm after Beta 1.8....., 
but I'm super glad I was there while it was the most charming game + 
community around the internet :)

comments.text:
+unknowngamer5407 I've played Minecraft since 1.4 beta, when cookies and 
dogs were introduced. Why do you care so much on how bad the community is? 
If you don't like minigame servers, find a survival server. If you don't 
like servers with little kids, find a server without little kids.


ANY game that gets popular will attract kids. The more mainstream a game 
is, the more likely younger players will pick it up. It's either popular 
and kiddie land or relatively unknown and mature. There's no middle ground.
